perturbation.original_text: 15. Choice of Law and Forum - This Agreement will be construed and governed in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, without regard to conflict of laws principles.
perturbation.changed_text: 1. License - Individual grants Lifeway together with its affiliates, subsidiaries, parent companies and their representatives and employees have an unlimited, perpetual, non-exclusive, worldwide and, except as set forth in Section 9, royalty-free, right to use, reuse, publish, reproduce, perform, copy, create derivative works, exhibit, broadcast, and display throughout the world the name, image and likeness of Individual in Marketing Materials (as defined below) in connection with marketing, advertising or otherwise promoting the Lifeway products and/or services and for historical reference and display purposes and other internal purposes, including without limitation, internal sales meetings. This Agreement will be construed and governed in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, without regard to conflict of laws principles. Notwithstanding anything herein to the contrary, Lifeway shall be under no obligation to cause the Marketing Materials to be displayed, published or performed. Individual further waives the right to inspect or approve the Marketing Materials.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the choice of law clause to the License section buries a crucial legal provision within a section detailing usage rights, making it less visible and potentially overlooked. This could hinder a party's ability to quickly understand the governing law in case of a dispute.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles regarding conspicuous placement of essential terms.

perturbation.original_text: 8. perturbation.explanation: The placement of the indemnification clause within the 'Entire Agreement and Amendment' section makes it appear as though it only relates to prior agreements or amendments to the contract, potentially obscuring its broader application to any misrepresentations in the marketing materials. This reduces its clarity and enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clear and unambiguous language for indemnification clauses.

perturbation.original_text: 7. Representation - Individual represents and warrants that any testimonial or review provided reflects her own honest opinions, findings, beliefs, or experiences. Individual represents that she is a bona fide user of Lifeway products and/or services.

perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Trade Commission (FTC) guidelines requiring clear and conspicuous disclosures of endorsements.
